023package org.opt4j.benchmarks.queens;
024
025import java.util.Random;
026
027import org.opt4j.core.common.random.Rand;
028import org.opt4j.core.genotype.PermutationGenotype;
029import org.opt4j.core.problem.Creator;
030import org.opt4j.core.problem.Decoder;
031
032import com.google.inject.Inject;
033
034/**
035 * A permutation decoder strategy. The permutation contains the values
036 * {@code 1,...,size}. This value indicates for each row in which column a queen
037 * is. This strategy ensures that queens do not attack each other in rows and
038 * columns.
039 * 
040 * The genotype is a {@link PermutationGenotype} of the length {@code size}.
041 * 
042 * 
043 * @author lukasiewycz
044 * 
045 */
046public class QueensPermutationDecoder
047                implements Decoder<PermutationGenotype<Integer>, QueensBoard>, Creator<PermutationGenotype<Integer>> {
048
049        protected final QueensProblem problem;
050        protected final Random random;
051
052        /**
053         * Constructs a {@link QueensPermutationDecoder}.
054         * 
055         * @param problem
056         *            the queens problem
057         * @param random
058         *            the random number generator
059         * 
060         */
061        @Inject
062        public QueensPermutationDecoder(QueensProblem problem, Rand random) {
063                this.problem = problem;
064                this.random = random;
065        }
066
067        /*
068         * (non-Javadoc)
069         * 
070         * @see org.opt4j.core.problem.Creator#create()
071         */
072        @Override
073        public PermutationGenotype<Integer> create() {
074                int size = problem.size();
075
076                PermutationGenotype<Integer> genotype = new PermutationGenotype<>();
077                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
078                        genotype.add(i);
079                }
080                genotype.init(random);
081
082                return genotype;
083        }
084
085        /*
086         * (non-Javadoc)
087         * 
088         * @see org.opt4j.core.problem.Decoder#decode(org.opt4j.core.Genotype)
089         */
090        @Override
091        public QueensBoard decode(PermutationGenotype<Integer> permutation) {
092                int size = problem.size();
093
094                QueensBoard queensBoard = new QueensBoard(size);
095
096                for (int i = 0; i < permutation.size(); i++) {
097                        queensBoard.setQueen(i, permutation.get(i), true);
098                }
099
100                return queensBoard;
101        }
102
103}
